Freedman Jewish Sound Archive
When:
2015-current
Initiatives:
Image Source: Marc Chagall. “The Fiddler (Le violoniste),” 1912-1913. Collection Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam. (Collection Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam).https://www.facinghistory.org/resource-library/image/fiddler-1912-marc-chagall
Visit project

Located in Penn’s Van Pelt-Dietrich Library, Room 453, this musical research library, international, and multi-lingual in scope, is a collection of approximately 5,300 Judaic sound recordings, in various formats (78, 45 and 33rpm, reel to reel and cassette tapes, compact discs, videos and DVDs).


Project Team and Advisors:
  • Robert (C '54) and Molly Freedman
  • Founders and Curators of the archive
  • Robert A. Friedman
  • Archivist
  • Ruthann Dorn
  • Audio Engineer and Assistant Archivist
  • Chava Kramer
  • Editor
  • Gilead Gevarayhu
  • Editor
  • David McKnight
  • Curator of SCETI
  • Dennis Mullen
  • Principal Web Designer & Developer
  • Alyssa Rosenweig
  • Student Web Developer
  • Travis Wieland
  • Scanning Technician
  • Julia Mullen
  • Scanning Technician
